intro: Godetia lehmanniana, commonly known as the Lehmann's godetia, is an annual flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in the summer months. It grows up to 3 feet tall, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
